characters: ON THE SURFACE OF THE WATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fishing boat pushes over choppy water. FOUR GUN TOTING MEN on Jet Skis wearing black wet suits and goggles escort the boat. Flying above it is a HELICOPTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERBIAN MAN captains the wheel. SERB 2 scans the horizon with binoculars. He checks the GPS system, then his watch, then speaks into his throat mic. All italics are Serbian w/ subtitles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes to delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JET SKIER in the lead weighs in on a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HELICOPTER PILOT weighs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All clear from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera descends as the boat passes, and dives beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The droning of engines becomes less pronounced. Foam from the boat and skis bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm. Then from out of nowhere five NAVY SEALs wearing RE BREATHERS appear, in neat formation like the Blue Angels. JET PROPELLED BACKPACKS push the SEALs through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LEAD SEAL: SHANE WOLFE, points upwards. All eyes follow his finger to the underbelly of the boat above. From his belt, Shane takes a steel wand with an adhesive disc attached, aims it at the fleeing boat and FIRES. A cable shoots up -- THUD... The disc sticks to the boat's hull. Shane pushes a button on the wand retracting the cable and drawing himself closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dangling from the cruiser, Shane fixes a BOMB to the hull. He releases himself from the boat and speeds away -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. A dense explosion sends ripples through the water and ELECTRICITY crackling around the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SURGE of ELECTRICAL FORCE blasts from the control panel. SPARKS fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Serbian Men jolt backwards -- WHAM -- and hit the wall. All the needles inside all the dials go LIMP. The roar of the engines DIES and the boat STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane slips inside the hull, through the new hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper slows to a hover.   The Pilot looks below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet skiers protectively circle the injured boat in a SYNCHRONIZED SWIMMING move, and the Jet Ski drivers are simultaneously YANKED below the surface: a split second later they're replaced by our SEALS (ALSO IN BLACK WET SUITS AND GOGGLES) -- the switch happens in less than a second, way too fast for anyone to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaken Serbs climb to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look around, and see the SEALS, on the jet skis: In the masks they are indistinguishable from the GUN-TOTTING MEN they switched paces with. All seems clear. Serb 1 pushes on the throttle... nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been hit. We're taking on water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the boat lists -- and water pours in, under the cabin door. They spring into action!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab the professor, quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serb 1 rushes out, shouting orders: He alerts four ARMED GUARDS and the Jet Ski drivers (now our Seals).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something must be below us! Shoot! Shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Armed Guards fire relentlessly into the water. Serb 2 rushes below deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR CHARLES PLUMMER, bound to a chair and gagged, tries to YELP as the room begins to flood with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serb 2 runs down steps to the lowermost hold. He tries to force the door open. When it finally opens, he is forced back by a three foot wall of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Plummer panics, as the water rises up to his mouth He struggles, but can't get free. Up to his nose, over his head.... He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Shane Wolf rises out of the water, hauling the Professor up. He cuts the Professor's GAG. Plummer screams. Shane removes his mouth piece. Shane doesn't seem the slightest bit fazed by the circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Shane Wolfe, United States Navy. I'm gonna get you outta here. But you have to do exactly what I say, when I say it. My way -- no highway option. Do you copy? (Plummer nods, terrified.) Where's the briefcase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor gestures across the room, where a metal BRIEFCASE is floating. Shane calmly HANDCUFFS it to his own waist. As the water rises, to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know where I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane sticks the mouth piece into Plummer's mouth, giving him his oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Armed Guards stop shooting into the water. One of our SEALS calls out to them, in PERFECT SERBIAN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEEP SHOOTING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards fire again. The SEAL speaks into his neck mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it a second, they're almost out of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Seal calls out: "shoot more, more!" They do, until there's nothing but empty CLICKS from their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Lieutenant. Chopper's four meters at your 10 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just before the water envelopes him and Plummer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mic) I've got the Prof and the case. First round's on me back at Virginia Beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane takes a deep breath, and pulls himself, the Professor and the briefcase UNDER the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane and the Professor rise to the surface as the boat falters behind them. Shane pulls out a retractable CROSSBOW. It clicks open and he shoots a CABLE into the belly of the helicopter above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane appears at the Pilot's door, holding the Professor. Shane addresses the Pilot in perfect SERBIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot nods, terrified. Shane TOSSES the Pilot out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane swings into the hot seat and grabs the controls, pulling the Professor in behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALS on the Jet Skis SALUTE Shane in the chopper, then disappear gracefully back into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane smiles, clearly he loves this kind of day. He looks beside him, the Professor looks terrified. The Professor takes out his mouth piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. I can't believe you... how'd we... That was the most incredible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane sticks the mouth piece back in the Professors' mouth, shutting him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better keep that on `til we get to the rendezvous point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the mouth piece) Why? Poison gas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the oxygen) No. I'm just not big on chit chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Pave Hawk SH-60 helicopter, rotors whirling slowly, waits. Shane's chopper appears from behind a tree line and sets down atop the mountain by a stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane and Charles sprint from the chopper towards the waiting Hawk. Charles stops Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, thank you. (He pats his briefcase) You saved more than just my life today. Can I call my wife to let her know I'm okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. Not imperative to the mission. We have to keep moving. I have strict orders to get you out of here safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm safe, Lieutenant. Please. She thinks I'm dead. (then) Don't you have a family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this gets him:) Make it quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles picks up his briefcase. He holds the lock up to his mouth and whispers into it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, Todd, Lulu, Peter, Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The briefcase pops open. Shane looks at him, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kids. It's voice activated. Designed it myself. I do security, that's my specialty. (gestures back:) Those guys back there tried to get this case open for five days -- couldn't crack it. And you should see what happens to you if open it without the code. I have a picture of my kids in here, you want to see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles takes a cell-phone out of the case. Shane looks in the case: it's EMPTY, except for the phone and a family PHOTO. Charles dials his cell phone... nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battery's dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane considers, then hands him his satellite phone. Charles dials, and talks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane climbs in the Hawk and approaches the cockpit.    T PILOT sits, back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost ready.    Just gives us a -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot slumps forward... DEAD. Shane turns-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor, RUN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM.   Shane drops, knocked unconscious.   All goes blac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter is on fire. Wolf lies facedown in the stream. He looks around, barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANE'S P.O.V.: Everything is a blur, in slow-motion. He sees Charles, unconscious. A Huey Helicopter lands. A VERY TALL MAN steps out, and takes Charles' Briefcase. There is huge explosion, as the chopper ignites. Everything is ablaze. Shane reaches out, grabs the picture of Charles' kids then goes unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD: 1 Month Later

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane lies in a hospital bed, despondent. His arm and face bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane's Captain enters: BILL FAWCETT (35) -- friendly, unassuming. He looks like he hasn't slept in days. Shane salutes him with his bandaged arm -- it hurts to salute, but he does it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you were Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill sits down beside the bed. He takes a long look at Shane. He holds a REPORT in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been through a lot together Shane. You're the best man I ever trained. And a good friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I know sir. And I except full responsibility for the mission's failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell did you let him use the satellite phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to call his family. A lapse in judgement on my part that I regret sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill shakes his head, disappointed. He pulls up a chair, and sits opposite Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Plummer was the best security expert the department of defense ever had -- a genius. He was working on a program that scrambles launch codes. He called it G.H.O.S.T.: Guided High-altitude Scrambling Transmitter. One pulse from the GHOST satellite and a country can't launch its own nukes. That's what the Serbians kidnapped him for, but they couldn't get S inside the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The case was empty sir, as I stated in my report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill considers this. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a surprise, really. Not like the professor to hide things where someone might look for them. G.H.O.S.T. is still out there, (Bill smiles:) which is why I'm going to give you another shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane sits up. He can't believe his good fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. Thank you. I... appreciate your confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invigorated, he pulls off bandages, disconnects an IV, and starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need to put a team together. I'm gonna need the mini sub, I need access to an EP3 aries 2 spy plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting:) Negative. It's not that kind of mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane listens, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days ago, I got a call from the professor's wife... Widow. She told me someone had broken into her home. Searched the place, top to bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's scared. The family's scared. Whoever killed the professor must think G.H.O.S.T. is in that house. Maybe it is, maybe it isn't. Either way, I need someone to stay at that house, and protect them. And while you're there -- find out if the program is in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? Why would you want me for that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The professor's wife requested you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is surprised... Bill pulls a tiny tape recorder from his pocket, presses play, we hear PROFESSOR PLUMMER'S voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm alive. Listen: A lot can happen between here and home -- if anything happens to me, call Lt. Shane Wolfe. He's a good man... anyway, I should go. I'll call you in an hour. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is shocked, hearing the dead man's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You gotta problem with this mission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirnosir. It's just that... I've never been very good with kids, sir. Not even when I was a kid sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane packs his duffel bag. He opens a drawer: There's five t-shirts, identical to the one he wears. He opens another drawer: Five khaki pants, also identical to the one he wears. He opens the closet: There's a massive fur- collared coat. Hm. He rejects it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane packs his duffel with military gear: GPS compass, night vision goggles, camouflage vest, machete... they all go in. Shane heads to the door, then goes back to his chest of drawers. He reaches in, and pulls out a small, old MEDAL: the ribbon is faded and frayed. He looks at it for a moment, then unzips his suit and pins it to the inside, like it's a lucky rabbit's foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi door opens. Shane looks like a bad ass, ready for anything. He steps from the taxi onto an adorable TROLL doll on the sidewalk. It SQUEAKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane's P.O.V.: Julie's unkempt suburban house, with toys all over the lawn, and a "BLESS THIS MESS" welcome mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane double-checks the address. The sprinklers go off. Shane darts to the door and rings the bell (it's one of those long cheerful doorbells).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE hear TINY FEET approach -- then the door swings open, Shane looks down -- and sees LULU, 8, peering up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane eyes Lulu. Lulu eyes Shane, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! There's some weird bald guy at the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM. Lulu shuts the door in Shane's face. Shane frowns. WE hear heavier footsteps approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMALE VOICE (o.s.) (before she sees Shane:) Look, if you're with the Hare Krishnas, we're not interested...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens revealing JULIE PLUMMER. Julie holds NAKED baby PETER, 2. She sees Shane, and stops, a little startled by his size...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (salutes:) Lieutenant Shane Wolfe, reporting for duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I'm so sorry.   Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him. He's not quite sure what to do -- he's a rock, he doesn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in and meet the rest of the gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's warm and quiet.   Petite Julie SCREAMS up the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIIIDDS!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane startles, covers his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your butts down here and say "hello!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then three pairs of feet come down the stairs. Lulu, ZOE, 15, and TODD, 14 line up like the perfect family portrait. Todd's hair hangs in his face. He wears a Sid Vicious shirt and a long trench coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already met Lulu. This is Peter, Zoe and Todd. Kids, this is Lieutenant Wolfe. He's the man who is going to be staying with us for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids except for Todd-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane nods, stern. On the stairs, a Romanian MAID walks by, carrying a BABY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Helga and Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane nods hello to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (official:) Ma'am... Baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids, go finish your homework.   And I'll be checking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe, Lulu and Todd climb back up the stairs. Julie leads Shane into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie sits, Shane stands "at ease" (which doesn't look "at ease" at all).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a pleasant family, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles wasn't around too much. His work took him all over the world. He'd be gone six or seven months at a time. So I think for the younger ones it's a little confusing. Zoe and Todd... well, they're dealing like your normal teenagers. Maybe in Todd's case semi-normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Plummer, I have to tell you that I did everything I could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles was in a dangerous business. I knew it when I married him. No one's to blame here. (beat) Everyone thinks that Charles told me or the kids where he hid it. And until G.H.O.S.T. is found, we're all in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing will happen to your family as long as I'm here. I've dealt with much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly from behind Shane's head a DUCK appears and NIBBLES his ear. Shane spins in full fight stance. He sees the Duck... and relaxes. Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Gary. He was Charles'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The duck QUACKS angrily. Confused, Shane returns to "at ease," keeping one eye on the duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Plummer-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Mrs. Plummer, I'll go secure the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Shane is already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane secures the area.       He paces off the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mounts surveillance cameras in the eaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He attaches contact alarms in the doors and windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane climbs a telephone pole, opens the circuit box and TAPS the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane, now wearing an EAR TRANSMITTER, crawls through the shrubs, hiding electric eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nighttime -- the family eats dinner. We slowly pull out... through the kitchen window... and reveal Shane with night vision goggles on scoping the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS inside. Through the window, Julie casually answers it. Shane touches his ear transmitter and LISTENS as he walks into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL (o.s.) Julie, it's Bill Fawcett. I have some potentially good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL (o.s.) A safety deposit box under Charles' name was just found in Switzerland. I think it could contain GHOST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful. This could all be over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL (o.s.) There's a catch. Swiss law says only his family can access it. I'm going to need you on a plane tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane, listening to the conversation, enters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Shane share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, with her suitcase, Shane, Helga and the Kids stand in the doorway. Zoe listens to her I-Pod ignoring the hug Julie gives her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about the Kids, Helga will handle everything. (Worried:) But if there is an emergency, all the emergency numbers are on the fridge. And on the phone. And on the back door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom -- we'll be fine, chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little choked up:) I know, it's just... I am a mom, it's my job to worry. ... I love you guys. I'm gonna miss you. I'll be back in 48 hours. And guys, whatever Lieutenant Wolfe asks you to do... do it. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: ll the children nod in agreement except Zoe who pops her chewing gum bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, I don't want you to worry about anything except the safety of my children. Helga will take care of everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. They'll be safe with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything will be fine, Mrs. Plummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie gets in the car and it drives away. Shane turns back to the kids who loom in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, are you licensed to kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she frowns) Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga trudges up the path and in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane, on a short ladder, screws in a surveillance camera into the corner of a wall when he hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALE VOICE (o.s.) Prepare to be annihilated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu SCREAMS. The sound of MACHINE GUN FIRING. Immediately, Shane leaps off the ladder and bounds down the stairs two at a time and into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hane rushes in -- and finds Lulu screaming and giggling in front of a VIDEO GAME. Shane shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you turn that dow-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Shane spies half of Todd's face peeking around a corner staring at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd disappears. WAAAAA!! WAAAAA!! Shane spins, looks around for the CRYING BABY... can't find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Where's the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking Lulu points. A diapered Peter stands in the half full AQUARIUM, pouring in Cheerios. Helga enters holding the wailing Tyler. Gary suddenly FLIES by - WHRRP! Shane ducks. Shane scowls at Helga:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You run a very loose ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like it? You're the SEAL. You do something. I make bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: elga stomps out. Shane heads down the hall, when in the corner of his eye -- he sees A FIGURE SCURRY ACROSS THE BACK LAWN. Shane turns off the light. He shuts off the window alarm and sneaks out silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yard is littered with toys. In the middle is a TRAMPOLINE. He spots the Figure climbing the TRELLIS. Shane runs, jumps onto the trampoline. He flies in the air and latches onto the figure. They both tumble to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane yanks off the DARK FIGURE's hood, revealing SCOTT (16) a nervous teenager. He's dazed, but alright, wearing SHARPER IMAGE night vision goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Zoe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe runs out the door, setting off the PIERCING ALARM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my boyfriend, tool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the one who broke in. Zoe -- go back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine... come on Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane grabs Scott by the scruff of the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with this kid. (to Todd:) You -- Gimme twenty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freaked, Scott fumbles for his wallet and gives Shane a twenty dollar BILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant PUSH-UPS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Befuddled, Scott starts to   do lame push-ups. Shane grab the back of Scott's shirt,   LIFTING him in the air, spinning him away from the   house like a marionette. Sco runs off, calling out from   across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'll call you, Zoe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe storms inside. Shane stands there, fuming. The Alarm's still blaring. The window of the house next door opens: a Korean couple, THE CHUNS, pop their heads out. They're arguing with each other in Korean. Shane addresses them, IN PERFECT KOREAN with subtitles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apologies. We had an intruder. A simple misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perfect English, no accent) We speak English, Kojak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Look, about the 2000 decibel alarm and the kleig lights and stuff... we own a bakery, so we're up kind of early. Would you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane pulls a remote control from his pocket and clicks it. The alarm stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a bunch. Oh, and we found this in our pool filter... Try to keep that zoo reigned in, huh baby-sitter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chun tosses him the TROLL DOLL and slam their window shut. Shane's about to head inside, he pulls a tiny camera phone from his pocket, and snaps a shot of the Chun's car in their driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hane marches Zoe up the stairs. Loud, angry rock music blares from Todd's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother thought you were in real danger. You should have told her the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think you are -- my dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe starts to turn -- then suddenly spins and tries kicking him in the CROTCH. But Shane catches her foot -- and whirls her away. She has to hop on one foot, to not fall over. He "hops" her down the hall to her room.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go! It's Saturday night.   I have plans!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe's back to her door, Shane flips her foot in the air. Zoe falls backwards into the room. Shane shuts her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane marches back down the hall, bangs on Todd's door-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TODD (o.s.) Bite me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane frowns, continues down the hall. He passes the NURSERY (Peter and Tyler's room), where Helga is singing a lullaby: (as annoying Has something Barney might sing).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're down and low, lower than the floor. And you feel like you ain't got a chance. Don't make a move `til you're in the groove, and do the Peter Panda Dance. Just hop three times like a kangaroo --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does a little "dance" that goes with the lullaby: She hops forwards three times, then "crab-walks" sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidestep twice, just like the crabs do. Three steps forward, one step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does. The Children, in bed -- laugh and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then quick like a turtle lie on your back! riggle like a snake `til you can't no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he wriggles on the floor. Then jumps up, to their beds. Shane shakes his head, keeps walking-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This family's in for a rude awakening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the neighborhood, warm orange light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is asleep. In the bedrooms, a SERIES OF SHOTS:

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Tyler snores in his crib.       Peter in his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ulu is surrounded by stuffed animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: odd is out cold, motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oe is wrapped in blankets. Until A TRUMPET BLARES "REVEILLE"! Zoe jumps, like she's been electrocuted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?   Wha--?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd sits up, disoriented, not understanding what's happening. The Whistle GETS LOUDER. Suddenly his door flies open -- and Shane strides in with a BOOM BOX. Todd blinks groggily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-what are you doing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're burning daylight. Move.       Move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sunday...! (he squints at a clock) And it's six a.m. You're insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd pulls the blanket over his head. Shane flips the mattress over spilling Todd to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd scrambles to his feet and out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the little kids are CRYING. Covering their ears. Helga runs through in hair curlers, half-asleep and angry, carrying the crying baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (She curses in Romanian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Not in front of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: he gives him a look of disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it matter? Nobody speaks Romanian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usca mi-as chilotii pe crucea lu mata!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga narrows her eyes, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (She curses Again, in Romanian.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children are assembled, lined up tallest to shortest. At the end on the floor is Baby Tyler, sucking on a bottle. Shane firmly starts his Patton speech:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up, ladies. Your behavior is unacceptable. In order to maintain a state of safety we need to maintain a state of discipline and order. I've only got one rule: Everything is done my way. No highway option. Do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   I said -- do you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("copying" him) What?   I said -- do you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not copy me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make up your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane starts to speak then thinks better, he's furious. Everyone stares blankly -- a tense silence. It's broken by the sound of a large AIR BUBBLE from the aquarium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P eter farted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone cracks up. Shane tries to maintain decorum. He reaches into his bag and unpacks a set of small high-tech SECURITY BRACELETS with a red light and a covered button. He straps one to each Kid's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking devices. Now that I know I can't trust you... Never take them off. The panic button is only for emergencies. Touch that -- you better be dying, or you're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not wearing that. Just because my mom's paranoid doesn't mean we have to take orders from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yells at her, Marine sergeant style:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me explain how the chain of command works. I tell you what to do -- and you do it. End of chain. Now I'm not gonna have time to learn your names. So you are -- (pointing) Red 1, Red 2, Red Leader, Red baby... wait, where's the older male? There were five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mysterious) He walks like Dracula, with footsteps silent like death --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane looks to Zoe for translation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry, Shane bounds up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: hane marches to Todd's shut door. He tries the knob, but it's locked. Shane bangs hard on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red 4!    Open this door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Shane turns away from the door and DONKEY KICKS it...SMASH! The wood CRACKS, then CRASHES inward. The entire frame collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hane charges in-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't have to go down like-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd isn't there. Down the hall -- a FLUSH. Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door opens, and Todd comes sauntering back. He sees Shane, the destroyed door and wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I need is a hammer and some plaster of Paris. I can fix this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piece of the ceiling falls, hits Shane on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embarrassed, Shane steps aside, then mutters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your bracelet. If you'd been wearing it, this wouldn't have happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane SNAPS it onto Todd's wrist, and head down the hall, patrolling. Zoe comes up the stairs, to her room. She stops at Todd's door -- they glare at Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: hane does one-handed push ups in the living room while the Duck watches. With his other hand he loads the PHOTO of the Chun's license plate into his laptop computer. His head shifts, he hears something suspicious -- the rumble of a car approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes for the front door, clicks his alarm remote and opens it, just as -- WHACK -- the MORNING PAPER connects with his face, hard. From off-screen we hear a PAPERBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SORRY DUDE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane rubs his nose. Lulu screams at the top of her lungs. Shane turns, to see that Peter is chasing her, wearing a towel as a sheet. He pretends to be a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whhhoooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Peter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu hides behind Shane. Peter Booos again. Lulu screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, good soldiers aren't afraid of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This house is haunted. Daddy even said so. He said there's a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then it hits Shane.       His eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   And where is this ghost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.     I've never seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane walks slowly down the hall. As he walks he glides his hands along the wall, feeling, pushing, scanning the ceiling. Searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd and Zoe kneel on the stairs. They surreptitiously pour COOKING OIL all over the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then -- a creak. Zoe whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he comes...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Todd run downstairs and hide behind the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane strides to the top step and RAPS on the wall. He RAPS again, listening for hollow spaces. Nothing. Shane lifts his left foot out to take a step down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he hears an alert from his laptop. He goes back to the living room, then turns his attention to his laptop. MR. Chun's photo appears next to a VEHICLE REGISTRATION. Shane scans it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd and Zoe's faces fall. The footsteps again-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming back-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Helga, carrying a huge laundry basket, appears, takes a step onto the stairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHH!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMP! BUMP! BUMP! She flies down the greased stairs, BANGING her head and ass on each step, all the way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: inally, BAM! Helga HITS the bottom with a mighty crash. She screams, as laundry flutters down from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gulp, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Julie, looking jet-lagged, sit across a desk from a SWISS BANKER. He seems to be about 100 years old. He's reading a HUGE stack of paperwork with a magnifying glass, mouthing along in FRENCH. It's taking him a LONG time. They wait patiently -- til their patience runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we discussed, this is an urgent matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Banker puts up a finger to "shush" him. Then looks back to the paperwork, then licks his finger to turn the page. He licks his finger again, but can't get the page to turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feebly gets up, and shuffles across the room to a WATER COOLER. He fills a paper cup with water and shuffles back to his desk. He dips his finger in the water to turn the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you call somebody? Do something to get us around all this paperwork?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Not in Switzerland, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill can't stand it anymore. He jumps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is absurd. If we can't get some faster service, we're going to have to file a complaint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Banker looks at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Banker, MARCEL, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Je ne comprende pas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bill and Julie:) I'm so sorry, the chief does not speak English. But I can tell you -- you will have access to the box tout-suite. As soon as your background checks clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. How long is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga, suitcases in hand, heads to the door -- Shane tries to block her path. Peter's in the aquarium. The duck flies around, QUACKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGGH!     These brats!   Sugi Pula!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Leader, remain calm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am calm. I QUIT, that makes me calm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not be hasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, RING! Amid the chaos, Shane moves for the phone. Helga takes the opening and runs for the door. He grabs her suitcase. As she tries to wrestle it away, Shane picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello--- (sees Helga crawling away) Don't even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suitcase handle breaks off, and Helga dashes for the door. Shane dives, grabbing her foot. He DRAGS her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Mrs. Plummer. (covering the phone, so Julie can't hear the struggle) No no -- everything's fine. You're gonna be gone how much longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: here's a pause, the camera DOLLY/ZOOMS as he says it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five business days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: elga's shoe comes off -- Helga falls forwards, and Shane falls back, against the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not a problem. Just doing my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his hand, that landed on a diaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga's at the door. Shane body-checks it closed. Helga struggles to get him off. CRUNCH. Helga chomps down on Shane's hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Things are GREAT!!! You do what you have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane lets go. Helga scampers out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care, Mrs. Plummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane hangs up the phone, as Helga makes a dash down the path to a waiting cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane chases Helga to the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Leader! I command you to come back! That is a direct order! You can't leave a man behind!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga jumps in the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the Peter Panda song!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cab pulls away, in the rear window, Helga glares back, then does an obscene Romanian hand gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His jaw drops in disbelief. He drops his head, defeated. Then -- he slowly glances up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Korean couple is staring at him, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, if she loves you, she'll come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rises, takes a deep breath and strides inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane enters... to find the kids are all gloomy.    The baby cries. Shane awkwardly picks the baby up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, listen up. There's been a change of plans. Your mom's not coming back as soon as she thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) When is she coming back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. In the meantime, we're just gonna have some more big fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we've been doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But tomorrow's a school day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a signed release for Driver's Ed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got Brownies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane reacts, inundated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, WHOA! HALT! We'll take this hill one inch at a time. Only then can we rise to the challenge. All for one, and one for all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) "Be all that you can be!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Army. I'm Navy.     But I appreciate your enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nice moment.   Until -- FWRPPPP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me that was the duck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FWRPPP!    WE zoom in on the baby's leering face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hane quickly moves the Baby away from his body. Pure self-preservation, everyone bolts from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   HEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody will help.     Even Peter runs, holding his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gulps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane enters, holding out the Baby at full arm's length. He lowers Tyler onto a changing pad, takes a deep breath, then pulls out PLIERS and a SCREWDRIVER. Using the tools as chopsticks, he cautiously unfastens the diaper... And then -- it flops open. SShane GROANS, repelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things I do for my country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane tries approaching -- he can't do it. Aghast, he looks around for a solution. Then: Shane picks up the Baby and dips the bottom half in the toilet, then FLUSHES, over and over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane patrols the hall, making sure all the doors and windows are locked. Lulu is in her pj's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand tugs on Shane's shirt, he looks down to see Lulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Zoe thinks you look like the Hulk. I think you're cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure how to respond...) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu doesn't go away, she just stares at him, it starts making Shane uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know Kung Fu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever punch someone so hard that their head came off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hane walks away from Lulu. She follows. Shane is again twirling the MEDAL in his fingers. Lulu follows at his heels, like a puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that medal for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll trade you a SpongeBob button for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane walks room to room, pulling down the shades on every window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so people can't hurt us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bends down to her level, and tries to sound sweet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think -- it's time for you take a nappy- poo, in beddibye land, little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu looks at him, like he's an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like I'm five to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu sulks off to bed, and shuts off her light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lights are out, all the kids asleep. Shane breathes a sigh of relief, and patrols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids are dressed for school. On the table in front of each place is a tan BAG. The kids sit down at their designated spots, confused by the MRE's (MEALS READY TO EAT) in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?    Dig in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd, Lulu and Zoe all tear open their bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd pulls out a bag of CORN BEEF HASH and a Snickers bar. Zoe pulls out a bag of FETTUCCINE ALFREDO and some matches. Lulu takes out a bag of turkey slices and a coffee packet. Shane smiles, proud of his accomplishment. The Kids stare at "breakfast," dubious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I can get lots more of those. And I've survived off this stuff for months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I'm really gonna eat all those carbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane turns to address them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, ladies. Your mama -- is not here to take care of you now. So -- here's how it's gonna be. We're gonna pull together, all for one, one for all. If I say in, you stay in, if I say out, you go out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stands in his chair, dancing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ba ba do the hokie pokey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not say at ease!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's only two, he doesn't have any idea what you're talking about. I don't have any idea what you're talking about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane sighs. Lulu asks Shane:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you kill a man with your bare hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play too many video games. (then:) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I can cross my eyes. Wanna see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu crosses her eyes at Shane, then at Tyler -- who SCREAMS at the top of his lungs. Shane turns to Lulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler hates it when I do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter starts bawling, too. He runs away, crying. The table cloth is yanked to the floor. And the phone rings. Shane answers, trying to hear over the screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plummer residence... yes, I know it's Monday. Oh. Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Zoe smiles at him, innocently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your vice principal. He said if you're late again, you and Todd are expelled. He wants to see you in his office. With your ... legal guardian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage door opens, dramatically unveiling Shane. He's wearing Tyler in a SNUGGLE. Across his chest, he's got a bandoleer of baby-bottles and juice boxes. Shane can't hide his contempt as he sees: Julie's WHITE MINIVAN. A bumper sticker declares "World's Greatest Mom." Shane puts Tyler in a CAR SEAT. Its interlocking buckle connects FOUR WAYS. Shane fumbles with it for a while. It just doesn't add up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on my watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane TIES the buckles in a fancy knot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car speeds out of the drive, backwards at sixty m.p.h.. It does a skidding 180 and heads down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big suburban school, Busses and PARENTS are parked at the curb, STUDENTS of all ages are hurrying inside. The Minivan skids completely sideways, into a TINY parking spot -- a death defying, perfect parallel park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP ON: a stopwatch. It hits ZERO, and at that moment, the SCHOOL'S BELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the stopwatch is the VICE PRINCIPAL MURNEY (50's). He's HUGE and mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always said these kids didn't need a baby sitter, they needed a parole officer. Looks like Mrs. Plummer finally listened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glares at Shane, and the Kids: Shane sits with Tyler in a Snuggle, holding Peter on a harness, as he plays on the floor. The Kids are seated around him, mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Shane) What's your name, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfe. Shane. Lieutenant. I'm in charge of watching these kids for... a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney is unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aby-sitter huh. Well, whatever work you can get. I'm Murphy. Duane. V.P in charge of discipline, conduct and truancy. Top to bottom, K thru 12. You're in my house now, boy. I coach wrestling, too. (re: Todd:) And the creeper here played hookey from every wrestling practice this month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids crack up. Murney is furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's missed twenty-two Driver's Ed classes. Out of twenty-three. They're the worst students in my school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney grimaces as PRINCIPAL CLAIRE NELSON (early 30's) enters. She's attractive, assured, tough. He withers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning kids. What are you doing in my office, Murney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was explaining, that as vice principal, I am in charge of....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very little. I thought I asked you to find out who stuck to the baloney slices to the cafeteria ceiling with mustard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm got some leads. (then, confidential:) My informant's about to crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then hop to it. I think I can handle this from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opens the door for Murney. He exits, fuming.     The BELL rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red 1, Red 2. Get moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teens hustle off to their classes. Shane checks his TRACKER -- two little red DOTS move away. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Claire eyeballs him... staring him up and down, as he casually holds the three kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. You're the new baby-sitter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodyguard. You see, Mrs. Plummer called my captain, she thought the kids needed -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Lieutenant, I was briefed of the situation by Mrs. Plummer. She told me all about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices NAVY SEAL tattoo on his upper arm. Claire sees this -- and suddenly reacts, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, huh? You with "The Teams?" (Shane nods.) Petty Officer Third Class Claire Nelson at your service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You're kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years at Naval base Coronado.   The Service paid for my college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane stares not sure whether to believe. On the spot, Claire looks nervously around. She lifts her pants leg... revealing a tiny ANCHOR TATTOO on her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Honor, Courage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commitment". That's the way I live my life, and the way I run my school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be too careful. So. Permission to stick around and keep eyes on the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission granted. Welcome aboard. Just try not to frighten the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will even notice I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane, dead serious, (Tyler in Snuggle) is riding the see saw in the school's playground. Peter rides on the other side with a group of KIDS, to balance Shane. Shane types on his laptop: CLAIRE NELSON. A picture of Claire in a Naval uniform pops up as well as her stats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean as a whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane closes the computer, picks up a pair of binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BINOCULARS P.O.V. as Shane goes from window to window of the school: Zoe is glaring at him through the window from her seat in a class. Todd, sitting in the back row of a class, yanks his hood over his head. Lulu waves from 2nd Grade, delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along line of FIRST GRADERS wait for the seesaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off. Official Business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane stands with his Baby snuggle. Peter is running in circles around him on his harness, like a tether ball. He checks his tracking device...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BINOCULARS P.O.V.: Five hundred students eat at long tables. Zoe, with a group of HIP FRIENDS, turns her back to him embarrassed. Todd, in line to get lunch, does the same. Lulu sees Shane and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane puts down his binoculars. He turns to the person in front of him, with stern intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up now. Save us both a world of pain. Now -- last time: Open the hanger, Black Hawk coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal: Shane is talking to Tyler, in his safety seat -- trying to get him to eat. Beside Shane, Peter is destroying a sandwich with animal crackers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open in T minus three, two, one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler gurgles, ignoring him. Shane sighs. Principal Claire sits next to Shane with her lunch tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say is the secret with kids, Mr. Wolfe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show no weakness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drink to that. (she toasts, with milk.) Shane... Can I call you Shane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. When you agreed to serve your country, I bet you didn't know you'd be serving creamed bananas to one year olds, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane gives her a look. Principal Claire smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- I out rank you, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here, you don't. You're on dry land, lieutenant. (she looks at his chair) Well, not so dry where you're sitting, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane sees that Tyler is pouring his juice Box all over Shane's pants. He yanks Tyler away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler starts to cry -- but Shane stops him from crying by making a funny face. Tyler laughs. Claire smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take this personally -- but you're pretty good at this. Seriously, I'm impressed. A whole day, and all three Plummer's stayed out of trouble. That's... unusual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there's a huge crash around the corner, and the sound of Students in an uproar. Shane hands Tyler off to the Principal and leaps over the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students are in a ring, cheering, as four STUDENTS in Wrestling Jackets hold Todd. One reaches down and gives Todd a "wedgy" then another WRESTLER punches him. Todd slips out of their hold and decks the Wrestler. VP Murney is watching, but not stopping it. Zoe, in the crowd, cheers Todd on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick his butt, Todd!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane and Claire push through the Students. As soon as they see the Principal, the crowd freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who started this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Then vice principal Murney steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did. (Todd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd started a fight with five students at once?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane turns to Todd, and "punches fists" with him, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid's mixed up. Look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I catch anyone on the team fighting again, next week's tournament is off. I don't care who starts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney smirks, and gives her a "I'll handle it" wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the lady. Any more fighting and there'll be no more wrestling. Personally I think that's a little harsh. Boys'll be boys. (low, to Todd:) `Scept for Plummer here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd lunges at him. Shane effortlessly grabs Todd and Judo FLIPS HIM -- Todd lands on his feet, sticking the landing. No one is more Ssurprised than Todd and Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Nice moves, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bell rings, the crowd breaks up. Murney approaches Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty slick, Frogman -- I'm a black belt myself. S'why they asked me to coach the wrestling team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney makes a loud Kung Fu CRY and throws a punch, stopping an inch from Shane's head. Shane doesn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See -- total control. Maybe you could stop by practice, we'd show the boys how a couple of pros do it, what do you say? Come on, promise I'll go easy on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sorry, sir. I'm on duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. That's right. I forgot you had to baby-sit. Maybe some other time then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane puts an arm over Todd's shoulder. Todd shakes him off and heads to class. Murney snickers to Claire:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like pretty boy there's all bark and no bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Don't even think it, Murney. He'd kill you so fast, I wouldn't even have time to get my camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane looks exhausted. Peter is asleep in his shoulder, Tyler is crying, as he keeps watch. The Principal strolls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day, another dollar twenty, minus taxes... aren't you gonna change him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to, for one who'll eat, and not cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I mean, Lt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Shane smells what she means -- Tyler's diaper is full. Shane recoils in disgust, holding Tyler out like a grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- change him. Roger that. Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, he pushes Tyler towards the Principal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirnosir. Not my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instructions are right on the box. Bathroom's down the hall. Have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, an alarm in his Jacket GOES OFF. He looks at his tracker: it's flashing RED 3 RED 3. Shane hands off Peter and Tyler to the Principal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane runs down the hall, following his tracking device. It leads him to a door. He bursts though it, doing a shoulder roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2ND GRADERS are sitting on the floor. Lulu is in front of the class, with the Panic Button in her hand. The board reads: SHOW AND TELL. Shane lands in fight stance -- the Class applauds. Next to Lulu is a very upstaged LITTLE BOY with a FROG. Lulu sticks her tongue out at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See! My nanny can kick your nanny's butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is furious, but the FINAL BELL rings. At that moment, his Tracker Alarm sounds again. He looks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP ON THE TRACKER SCREEN: Two DOTS labeled RED 1 and RED 2, are heading away from the school fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane runs with Lulu through the mob of Kids. He hands her to the Principal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane dives into the Minivan. The DOTS on the tracker are headed North. He speeds away after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLINKING DOTS on his tracker are side by side, racing down the road ahead of Shane. They make a sharp right. Shane makes a right, almost tipping the minivan. He blasts through a red light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns a corner -- a PLYWOOD WALL surrounds the site. He leaps out of the minivan. He looks at the tracker: Zoe and Todd are dead ahead, through the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two BIG CONSTRUCTION workers are standing on the other side of the plywood wall -- Shane KICKS out one entire section, and charges through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What hell do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around, to see several CONSTRUCTION WORKERS, all brandishing tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me where the kids are and I'll let you all live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, you're about to get a beat down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Workers rush him. Shane easily takes them out. The remaining Workers give Shane a scared look -- then RUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alone. He catches his breath, then checks his tracker. Todd and Zoe's BEEPS are coming from a MANHOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane pries off the manhole cover.    He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE MANHOLE - It's dark and dank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sweat. Shane lowers himself down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane lands shoulder deep in DISGUSTING SLUDGE. He winces, then checks the tracker -- the DOTS are CLOSE, feet away. Shane trudges through the river of muck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red 1?   Red 2?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's horrific. The DOTS BEEP LOUDER. He's almost there! He splashes around a corner -- then gasps -- he sees the blinking lights below the surface. He takes a deep breath and dives under. He comes up for air with ZOE and TODD'S HOMING BEACONS. A note is tied to them: "Ha! Ha!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Claire sits with the Kids in the living room. From outside, they hear the front door open, and the sound of OMINOUS, SQUISHY footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the door swings open, revealing Shane, looking like a Swamp Creature. Everyone gasps, then covers their noses. A CUTE YOUNG COP enters behind Shane. Todd stiffens. Zoe fixes her hair. The Cop looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 year old Male, weird hair. 16 year old female. Ditto. (into his radio:) Cancel that a.p.b..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cop turns to Shane, with a smirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the future, use our nonemergency number. That's the one to call if nobody's fleein' or bleedin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cop leaves, Zoe checks him out as he goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eerily calm:) Just fine, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Covering her nose. The smell is BAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should probably get going then. If you need anymore help... Call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She practically GAGS as she passes him. Shane looks around at Scott and Zoe, he doesn't say anything, but with his hand he makes a "my eyes on you" gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is in the shower. He pours an entire bottle of SHAMPOO over himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane BURNS his clothes in the barbecue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler is in a high-chair, Peter rocks in a cradle-swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane enters, in just a towel. He sees on the fridge; Helga'S SHOPPING LIST -- all junk food. He looks at it, cringing in disgust, before he notices:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting around the table are Lulu's entire BROWNIE TROOP - a dozen little girls in uniforms, they're staring at him. The Brownies applaud, and whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oo hoo! Hubba hubba!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane covers up and leaps into the Family Room, pulling Lulu after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are those people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my troop, it's Monday. Monday, Wednesday and Saturday are troop nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. Everybody's parents go out on troop nights. They won't be home `til ten. Mom's our den mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu starts to sniffle, close to tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight we're supposed to sell cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selling cookies isn't imperative to my mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to. If we don't sell enough cookies, we can't go the Jamboree, and if we can't go to the Jamboree. (whispers:) Come on, Shane. You gotta help me out. They already think I'm a loser. And it's not like I have any other friends, cause mom never lets me out of her sight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu's about to burst into tears. Shane sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane, back in "uniform," paces in front of the Brownie Troop. They are assembled, at attention, Indian Style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, ladies. Here's how it's gonna be. Tonight, I'm gonna be your den -- commander. That means if you want to live to see tomorrow, do as I say. DO WE UNDERSTAND EACH OTHER?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brownies stare art him in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Den Mother? ... I'm scared of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now -- wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brownies are in the living room, unpacking boxes of cookies, getting ready to go. Zoe's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... yeah, he's a total psycho. I think mom found him from one of those Tough Love boot camps or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane blows passed her, revving a cordless POWER DRILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS: As Shane uses the drill to seal every window and door. He's not just locking them -- he's SCREWING THEM SHUT WITH DRYWALL SCREWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane's finishing up the last window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is totally cruel and unusual! You can't do this -- we could run out of air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane lifts her window so it's open a HALF INCH, then drills it into place. Shane ushers the Troop out the door, then loads Peter and Tyler into TWO SNUGGLES -- one attached to his front, the other to his back. Shane closes the front door and attaches a "Club" lock to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane Loads the brownies and toddlers into the minivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the minivan pulls out of the driveway, the camera CRANES up to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, Zoe picks up the phone, hits speed-dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .. he's got us on lock-down, it's like Oz or something. No, not munchkin Oz -- HBO Oz. (she listens:) Hm... I dunno if that's a good idea, Scott...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane pulls the minivan into the crowded parking lot -- the Brownies are all singing 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall at the top of their lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane (double-Snuggled) helps the Brownies set up a card table to display their cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get supplies. I can see you through the window, but if anything happens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flashing her bracelet) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane watches the Brownies on the store's CLOSED CIRCUIT monitor, as he pushes a cart into the store. He looks around at the bright, colorful boxes of Children's Cereals, Rainbow Fruit Roll-Ups, Snack packs... NOTHING looks familiar -- nothing even looks like food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees: a huge, 100 pack VALUE CASE of SPAM. He smiles. Tyler looks at him -- "what are you, nuts?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brownies are trying to sell the cookies, but they're very shy. SHOPPERS blow passed them without even noticing them. One of the Brownies spots something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... they're back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: In a shot out of Reservoir Dogs, we see who she means: A group of bad ass, chubby CUB SCOUTS. They're headed straight towards the cookie table, menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to another Scout) Hey Skeever, what's stinky and floats `til you flush `em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brownies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scouts cackle. The Ugly Scout yanks a box of cookies away from Lulu. He rips it open, dumping the cookies on the ground and grinding Uthem with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Troop 16 territory. How are we supposed to sell raffle tickets when this place reeks of your skanky cookies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT IT, before I get my face punching badge on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brownies take off running, clutching their boxes. One of the Scouts grabs Lulu -- she tugs and tugs, but can't get away. Finally, the Cub Scout takes her SCARF. He laughs, and lets her go. The Cub Scouts high-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane heads to the Brownie's table -- but Lulu and the Brownies are gone. In their place are the Chubby Scouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my troops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I haven't seen anybody, you Skeever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. You wanna buy a raffle ticket? We're trying to win .22's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around his neck, Shane's monitor starts beeping. Shane takes off running in the direction of the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane runs up to the minivan. The Brownies are huddled behind it, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? (No one answers) Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those boys over there broke our cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane eyes the Cub Scouts. Dead serious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then -- I'm afraid I have to eliminate them. If I don't come back -- avenge my death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads toward the Scouts. The Brownies scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane stops. He bends down, and points at Lulu's Panic button. He firmly tells Lulu, who's close to tears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a toy. I'm here to protect you. Not cookies. Get in the car, we're going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't take us home yet, you're supposed to take us to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An extreme CU of the Chuck E. Cheese MANAGER. He wears braces and head-gear, which causes him to lisp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Chuck E. Cheese!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wider reveals...CHAOS. SCREAMING CHILDREN everywhere. On stage, the Chuck E. Cheese automaton band JAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I were in Chechnya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brownies are running around, playing video games and skee ball. Shane's watching Peter, in the PLASTIC BALL POOL, while he holds Tyler in the Snuggle. The Manager approaches Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything elsh I can do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a big glass (he shows him)   This much ice... this much cyanide.
