dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Manager laughs, but the headgear seems to hurt his face when he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout a re-fill on that pischer of Mischer Pibb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing:) Pischer of Mischer Pibb?   Mischer Pibb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, the Manager picks up a pitcher and exits. Lulu approaches, she grabs Shane by the sleeve and drags him over to the stand up Mortal Kombat game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's fight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm watching your brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pressed two player. I thought you liked combat. Unless you're scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane doesn't like the sound of that. He steps up to the machine. He cracks his knuckles, stretches. Then he takes a joy stick. He checks over his shoulder -- Peter's happily splashing about in the plastic balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN: they each select a fighter. Lulu picks a small female character. Shane picks a man who looks LIKE SHANE. They begin, Lulu screams out with her fighter, in unison:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare to be annihilated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaps over Shane in a somersault and throws a DOZEN throwing stars. Then kicks him in the head repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair. Nobody can jump thirty feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hulk can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't a documentary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second round starts, Brownies have gathered around to watch. Lulu's fighter does a series of kicks. Shane can't even get one punch in -- she pins him to the ground, kneels on his head, then kicks him in the face. Shane is taking it really seriously. He's really mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't fair. My joystick's broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna switch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They switch sides. Round three starts. Lulu's fighter picks up Shane's in the air, spins her, then cracks her in half over his knee... and then a kick in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the Snuggle) You don't have a baby on your chest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu's having fun now, she's just avoiding Shane's fighter, dancing, jumping, while he pounds the buttons, swinging and missing... Shane's really fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not even trying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I AM TOO TRYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too slow... come on -- take a shot... oops too slow... swing and a miss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps dancing. It's really annoying. Shane's working the joy stick hard, slamming buttons, but he can't hit her. He is KO'd. She does a very obnoxious VICTORY DANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your face! I am the greatest hand-to- hand combat champion in the entire world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane screams and RIPS THE JOYSTICK OFF THE MACHINE. Sparks fly. Shane looks around to see if the staff noticed. He and the Brownies sneak away, leaving the sizzling machine, its joystick dangling by its wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe's on the phone, the Zhouse is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom -- stop worrying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a mom, it's my job to worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, everything's cool. The guy's just a control freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a few more days. I hate leaving you, but you know I have to do this. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Don't worry, we're okay. Tonight I'm just doing homework -- in my cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Zoe hangs up, we WIDEN OUT: The house is PACKED with TEENAGERS: they're keeping quiet until the phone is in its cradle, then the TEENAGE DJ starts the music back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe looks around at the mess. She turns to Scott, who doesn't seem concerned at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, this is outta hand. Who are all these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus' ma peeps. And the folks who read my BLOG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe rolls her eyes, then notices a WEIRD SWEATY KID, who's throwing mustard covered baloney slices at the ceiling, where they stick with a satisfying SQUISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, not cool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS - The Plummer House:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Its a huge party: the place is JAMMED, kids everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Teenagers come and go through the kitchen's DOGGY DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane (Tyler in Snuggle), loads Brownies into the minivan, counting them. Barking at them like Marines:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move, move, move! Go go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane drives, the Brownies are singing 99 Bottles... again. Suddenly, a look of horror comes across Shane's face... he spins the minivan in a 180 and floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane (Tyler in Snuggle) bursts in, the Brownies follow. We see what he forgot: PETER, still happily playing in the pool of plastic balls. The Manager is watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you'd come back for him -- they almost always do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inexcusable, to leave a man behind like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, we once found a kid in the ball pool when we opened in the morning --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane wades into the ball pool and pulls Peter out, which is fine, except that he's MISSING HIS DIAPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOA, Whoa. Not okay, freestyling in the ball pool -- not okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane grimaces. He holds his breath, and goes down for the diaper. He disappears under the balls -- for a long time. The Manager and the Brownies share a concerned look. He's still down there. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we send someone in after him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He surfaces, gasping. He's holding the diaper, out away from him. He charges across the room with the diaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear out! GO GO GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he bursts out the other doors, at a full run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is exhausted, as he pulls up in the Minivan. He gets out -- and groans in disbelief. It's insanity: HIP HOP blasts, gyrating TEENAGERS everywhere, chugging drinks, making out, peeing in the bushes, jocks throwing footballs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reeling, Shane takes Lulu, Peter and Tyler up the path. He protectively guides them past the craziness -- until a football suddenly WHIZZES by. Outraged, Shane snatches it mid-air -- then CRUSHES the ball. POP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hane gives a blood-curdling stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jocks flinch, scared, then RUN.   Shane unlocks the CLUB lock off the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside is worse, a total wreck.   Zoe's dancing with Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane drags the needle across a record at the D.J.'s turntables. Everyone recoils from the horrible sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one leaves until this house is spotless! I want to be able to eat off the floor! The latrine! Hell, I wanna be able to eat in the kitchen!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous glances -- then everybody suddenly RUNS for the back! Shane is confused, trying to understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: then he intuitively dashes past them! He's scoping the surroundings... windows... vents... AH! The doggy door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is halfway through the doggy door when Shane grabs his ankles and yanks him back in. Shane holds Scott upsidedown by his ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no you don't. Now, we're gonna do this my way -- no highway option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then: A MUSTARD SOAKED BALONEY SLICE drops from the ceiling, sticking to the TOP of Shane's head. PLOP. Shane's eyes narrow, he takes it off, trying to maintain his dignity. He fumes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start swabbing, ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Scott the mop. Scott gulps - and starts mopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miserable TEENS scrub. In a bathroom, Scott and Zoe, in Playtex gloves, furiously clean. Scott scrubs the toilet with Pinesol as the Duck swims in the top of the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is officially the worst party ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was YOUR idea! I don't even know most of these losers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane inspects the house, as kids clean. Shane wipes a finger down the sofa. Clean. He lifts the sofa, and rubs his finger UNDER IT. He holds it up to a KID... residue. The Kid quickly starts cleaning again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GIRL reorganizes a stack of CD'S. Shane goes over them, straightening -- then he notices something. He pulls out a CD: It is a home-burned disk, labeled with a Sharpie. It reads: GHOST. Oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two DARK CLAD FIGURES watch, through binoculars. They see Shane find the CD, and walk out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane quickly tucks the CD into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long line of exhausted party-goers files out. Scott's the last one to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane works his way through the house. It's SPOTLESS: counter tops glisten, furniture polished. It looks like Better Homes and Gardens. He heads upstairs. Zoe blows past him -- into the bathroom, where she throws up. Shane sits down, outside the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Thanks a lot, Rambo. My friends will never come here again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those people aren't your friends. They show no respect for you or your house. Because you have no respect for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do too respect myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ueasy, she pukes again. Shane hands her a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got barf on your tank top. (Announces:) Company, downstairs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks down the hall, Zpounding on doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not my dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane stops. Lulu and Todd step into the hall. Zoe gets up, shaky and furious, and screams in Shane's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hate you, you hate us. You're like a robot. Why don't you just leave us alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Lulu's crying, Todd picks her up. Shane stands, helpless. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Red 1. I'm not the man for this job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all my years I have never been treated with such disrespect. Not even from the enemy. Don't worry, as soon as your mom comes back, I'm gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly -- the power goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, tired) It's Scott...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puberty... talking doesn't do any good. Go to your rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, TWO NINJAS, all in black BURST in through the window. Shane spins in fight-stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the kids:) Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified, Zoe and Todd scoop up the kids and rush down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ninjas pull a retractable KENDO STAFFS. Wielding them with great skill. It takes all of Shane's skill to fend them off -- the three fight, close-quarters and fast. Until Shane pulls down attic's spring-loaded FOLDING LADDER and clocks a Ninja with it. He goes down, but Shane is SHOCKED from behind by the other NINJA. The Ninjas attack, fiercely -- they're good. Their Kendo staffs hiss with a powerful ELECTRIC CURRENT. The Ninjas knock Shane backwards down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GHOST -- hand it over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leap down after him, pounding him with their staffs, knocking him into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are TOYS EVERYWHERE -- like a tornado hit a TOYS-R- US. Shane fends the Ninjas off. He spots a BASEBALL BAT, and grabs it, facing them, fiercely. They step back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- who wants some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane swings the bat down on a Ninja's head: It's a whiffle bat, it makes a silly thunk. Shane and the Ninja share a surprised look -- then the Ninjas charge. Shane fends them off with his Whiffle bat. With his foot, he picks up a FISHER PRICE CORN-POPPER, and uses them both to fend off blows. It rattles and pops as he fights with both Toys -- until a Ninja breaks them with one blow. Shane sees a FARMER JOHN TALKING GAME. He jumps up onto a shelf and grabs it. He pulls the string, and swings the plastic disk like a deadly bolo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rooster goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK, he hits a Ninja in the head. He swings the Farmer John like a bull whip -- until a Ninja knocks the shelf over. Shane crashes down, toys fly, several FURBIES hit the floor. They echo the fight:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane sees: The Ninjas are wearing only Ninja socks -- no shoes. He grabs a barrel of LEGOS, and flings them all over the floor. The Ninjas move towards him -- the Legos and Jacks dig into their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Ow ow! Crap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ninjas fight as they hobble around, avoiding Legos, Shane runs to the changing table, then violently squeezes DESITIN at a NINJA, blinding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane hangs in the doorway and swings at them, KICKING a Ninja in the chest. The Ninja CRASHES through the window!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he other Ninja looks up, fearful. Suddenly he grabs a bottle of BABY POWDER. He sprays it in Shane's face... POOF! The room fills with a CLOUD OF WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squints, blinded. The cloud dissipates... and Shane sees he's now alone. He runs to the broken window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ninja's are long gone. Shane bangs the window sill, disappointed to have lost them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Composing himself, Shane approaches Zoe's door.     He quietly knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids.   It's safe. You can open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause -- then the door creaks open. The kids run out and hug Shane with all their strength, bawling. Todd and Zoe enter, terrified. Shane isn't sure what to do... Then, he hugs Peter and Lulu. He really hugs them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't leave us Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs them, even Zoe is crying and hugging Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for giving you a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were they? What did they want...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're looking for a program, that your father invented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Mom's not paranoid? There really are people out to get us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out the CD labeled GHOST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not after you. They want this. But nothing's gonna happen to you, as long as I'm here. And I'm not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids shudder, relieved. They hug him tighter. He looks Zoe, eye to eye. He dries her tears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can't do this without your help, okay? We need a little more cooperation here. (the Kids nod) Tell you what -- let's start over. From now on, you listen to me, and do what I say. (to Zoe and Todd:) And I... I'll listen to you too. Deal? Truce -- okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Todd nod. Shane offers his hand to shake. They shake -- then they hug him, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane and the Kids sit around Shane's computer. Shane slips the Ghost CD in the disc drive, pushes play --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon c'mon c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND comes on: it's MUSIC. "Unchained Melody." And then, PICTURE: Demi Moore and Patrick Swayze at a pottery wheel. Shane is furious -- a long pause. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe laughs: she can't help it, it's been a long night. Then, the other kids join in. Soon, even Shane is laughing too: the telephone RINGS -- they all jump, startled. Zoe answers it, all smiles, she tries to play it cool and not frighten her mother:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey mom we're fine, absolutely nothing happened you should worry about. Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Plummer... two men tried to get into the house tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - it's okay. They're gone, everyone's fine. They were looking for GHOST, but they didn't find it. You have any luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes and no. We found something in the box... But we're not sure what it is. Bill thinks it's part of the GHOST. It looks like some kind of "key". We just don't know what its for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up the strange, metal two pronged KEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good news is I'll be home in two days, as soon as the customs paperwork clears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very genuine) ...So soon? We were just starting to have fun. Don't worry -- we'll be just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning, students run in to school. The minivan pulls up, and Shane emerges with the five kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta warn you guys: From now on, I'm gonna be sticking even closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEACHER shows the children how to dye Easter eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE on Lulu, making a mess of an egg.   She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE on Shane, squashed at a little desk.   He dips an egg in some purple dye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's Ed. An obstacle course with cones. Zoe nervously drives a small sedan, a crazed TEACHER next to her. He is gesticulating, SCREAMING, reacting each time she HITS the gas, then BRAKES, HITS the gas, then BRAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane stands off to the side, shaking his head.    Peter and Tyler are tight in their Snuggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEACHER hangs a series of cute "Turkey Hand" drawings above the blackboard (the kind where your fingers make the feathers). She hangs one of a HUGE HAND, and smiles at Shane, who sits in the back, sunglasses on. Shane nods, "yeah, I know it's good." Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will Shane Wolfe please report to Vice Principal Murney in the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu's classmates all chant, in unison:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooooooh! (You're in trouble!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane enters. Zoe sits in a folding chair, mortified. She is holding a broken-off SIDE VIEW MIRROR. Murney stands, Principal Claire next to him. They look concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. So, she wrecked a driver's Ed. car -- she'll pay for the damage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That? Lady drivers, what do you expect. No, it's not that -- it's the boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red two? I mean Todd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire nods. Shane gives Zoe a look. Zoe shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordinarily I would wait for his mother to return... but -- I'm a bit concerned, and I'm not sure what to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he been skipping class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- yes. He does always miss sixth period. But this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney calls into the hallway. Todd enters. Shane stops, in shock: Todd's long hair is all shaved off, he now has a bleach blonde BUZZ CUT, giving him a "skinhead" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how he showed up to practice. And that's not all. I was doing a little re- con in his locker... and I found this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney hands Shane a book and Shane flips through it. It's a book of photographs of NAZI UNIFORMS. Shane scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he'd had Hustler or something, boys will be boys -- but this is just sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a NAZI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's certainly not normal. (pulls Shane aside.) See if you can talk to the boy.   Find out what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane shakes his head: Todd is worse than he thought. Todd and Zoe stand to go, and Shane walks them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WRESTLING TEAM is assembled, stretching. They snicker and shake their heads at Todd, as he passes. Shane walks the kids out, and Murney chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hope you won't go light on him -- that whole family's no good, if you ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good man, Shane. Bet you're a hell of a fighter on the mats, huh? (Shane ignores him, and keeps walking.) Maybe sometime we oughta strap up, we'll give these boys a treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He "fake-punches" one of his Boys -- who flinches like Murney has maybe hurt him a couple times. Murney laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another time, maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a date then. I'll show you a couple moves. I promise I won't hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane walks away. Without warning, Murney lets out a Kung Fu SCREAM, and leaps at Shane, kicking him in the BACK, Shane trips forwards to his knees. Murney tells his team:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that? You never know when your adversary is going to strike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kick me in the back? Is there a footprint on my jacket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane dusts off his back, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Frogman! Don't be a sissy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane turns back. It looks like Shane might fight, but instead he takes a deep breath, and leaves. Murney shakes his head, and snickers to his Team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minivan pulls up, with Shane and all the Plummers piled in. Shane parks, Todd runs towards the house. Shane holds Todd back by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait Todd, I want to talk to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: odd yanks his arm away and runs into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane knocks on Todd's door. Nothing. He enters. The window is wide open, Shane checks his window alarm -- there's a REFRIGERATOR MAGNET stuck to it, keeping the contact, so the alarm didn't go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane looks out the window -- far down the block, he can see Todd, running around the corner. Shane hops out the window. He sees Zoe, peering out her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe, you're in charge. If anyone gets within forty clicks of the perimeter, signal me. Keep all doors sealed, do your homework, preheat the oven, and make sure Lulu brushes her teeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to shut the window, but the Duck leaps up on the sill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want in or out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duck leaps out. Shane screws the window shut. On the corner, Shane sees Todd climbing on to a CITY BUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane picks a GIRL'S BICYCLE up off the front lawn. It's pink, with a flowered basket. It's small for him, but he hops on and pedals furiously after the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane, on the girl-bike, pedals after the bus. A few HOMEBOYS watch him pass, curiously. He nods back, tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus stops in a rundown neighborhood Todd hops off the bus. Shane's arrives a moment later, dripping sweat. He stashes the bike behind a mailbox...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane'S P.O.V.: At the entrance to the old warehouse, Todd meets up with three other TEENAGE BOYS, they're dressed in brown HITLER YOUTH UNIFORMS, they head inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane follows them, stealthily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane follows the Hitler Youth into a large room, set up with folding chairs. He hides in a dark corner. Todd and the Hitler Youth enter, and take seats. A CREEPY MAN in a scarf walks out, and stands in front of them. Shane watches as the MAN addresses the Hitler Youth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. All my Nazis are finally here. Okay, I want all of you at attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nazis stand at attention. Shane is horrified...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on stage left - (he yells) VON TRAPPS! I need my Von Trapps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hane watches... as a group of blonde ACTORS, all dressed in lederhosen as the SINGING VON TRAPP family enter, and join the "Nazis." There's also a few NUNS, a CAPTAIN VON TRAPP, and a MARIA. The Creepy Man is, in fact, a good natured, slightly foppish DIRECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okeydokey. Starting from where we left off Gimme Rolf and Liesl -- let's give You are Sixteen a run up der flagpole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd heads up to the stage, the Director arranges him and the ACTRESS PLAYING LIESL (40ish) into position. An ACCOMPANIST begins on piano, Todd sings, remarkably well:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait little girl, on an empty stage/for fate to turn the light on/your life little girl, is an empty page/that men will want to write on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To write on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are sixteen, going on seventeen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane bursts into laughter. His whole face lights up for the first time ever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd and Liesl dance. Todd is good, but nervous. He attempts a spinning kick, but he slips, and hits the stage, clutching his ankle. He gets up, and limps to the seats. The Director walks onto the stage, upset. He looks up, to heaven:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Jesus, have I done some unspeakable evil that I deserve to be saddled with the world's worst production of Sound of Music? (he shouts, at the cast:) We open in a week. The set's not finished... The cast is a bunch of clumsy goats -- every kick ball change would make Bob Fosse dig himself out of the earth, so he could have a heart attack again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I'll get it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of you will ever get it right! Which is why, I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws down his script. The Cast is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, he exits stage right... end scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, on his own cue... he exits stage right, in a huff. The entire cast looks to Todd, fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane jumps up from his hiding place, startling everybody. Everyone steps back. Todd is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane kneels down beside Todd. He closes his eyes, and begins rubbing his hands together like Mr. Miyagi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna fix him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. My hands are freezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane grabs Todd's ankle hard and unceremoniously CRACKS it, and yanks him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to quit. I hate wresting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT EASE. (Todd shuts up) Would you listen, just once? Look, I don't know a hell of a lot about this kinda stuff, but... You're good. A lot to learn, but with hard work, discipline -- you could make a go of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but what about Murney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy's an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd smiles, relieved. They sit on the edge of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sound of Music" is a great show. My dad took me to see it when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane smiles wistfully. Todd relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem like the musical type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Julie Andrews was hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if... girls'll think I'm... weird or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what girls think is weird? Wrestling. Men in leotards pinning each other to the floor? I've never understood that. Chicks dig guys who can dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter now anyway... show's off... it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane looks at the Cast, they look pretty glum as they pack up their costumes. Todd looks devastated -- only a moment after Shane saw him happier than ever. Shane straightens up, grabbing Todd by the shirt collar. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMPANY -- CENTER STAGE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks around, they're not sure what to do... off Shane's glare, they quickly assemble on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO YOU, OR DO YOU NOT HAVE WHAT IT TAKES TO PERFORM THIS MUSICAL?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some mumbling. Liesl chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a director...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No director? I have directed rescue missions in Afghanistan! I've directed numerous snatch and grabs in countries who's names you are not allowed to know. I have choreographed multi-pronged amphibious landings and stealth air attacks! (full of bravado) Do you think I have the stomach to whip this production into shape, or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone nods... Todd looks up at Shane. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YESSIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane's patrolling the hallway. He hears Zoe in her room, BREAKING something, angrily. He peeks in -- just as Zoe THROWS her cell-phone into the wall, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Nothing... It's stupid... Scott. I called him in his room, another girl picked up the phone. I know it's no big deal. I don't know why I let it get to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see what you see in this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just nice to think someone's thinking about you, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (He nods) It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No wait! ...What are you gonna do? You're not gonna hurt him are you? Promise you won't touch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I promise. I won't touch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane exits. He turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane tucks Lulu into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane looks at her surprised. He sits on the bed... Stumped. Then he starts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's see. Once there was a family of Elves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day, the little Elf family -- Uh. Went into the magic forest. To find a secret gnome... facility, where gnomes where turning mushrooms into... Uranium. The elves had to go in and take it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were ordered to. By the Elf Unit commander at Elf station bravo. So -- they waited for cloud cover, and they came in from the north...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Shane finishes the story, he illustrates, setting up the scene with DOLLS, on Lulu's floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elf Team decided on an L Ambush -- so three elves formed a base leg and laid down a heavy suppressive fire on the gnomes while the others maneuvered around to the right flank and walked through finishing off anything left alive... I mean standing...                    D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane's really into the story. Lulu's fallen asleep. Shane's eyes are brimming with tears as he finishes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And not one Elf got left behind that day. We got `em all. Even, the teeniest little elf of all -- Rodriquez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, from across the hall, Peter WAILS.   Todd pops his head in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to do the Panda Dance... or he won't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon... I can't remember that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll write it down for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wails get louder and LOUDER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler's asleep. Shane sighs, and whispers to Peter, reading from Todd's notes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're down and low, lower than the floor. And you ain't got a chance. Don't make a move `til you're in the groove, and do the Panda Dance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter starts bawling. Shane doesn't know what's wrong. Todd calls from the doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to do the dance. Like dad used to do. He made it up for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane sighs. He sings again, mortified. He does the dance as he sings... Shane hops forward three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hop three times like a kangaroo -- Sidestep twice, just like the crabs do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter applauds. Humiliated, Shane crab-walks sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take three steps forward and one step back... (He does.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mr. Chun gets his paper, Shane, (Tyler in the snuggle), hands out bag lunches as the Kids load into the minivan. Shane turns and catches Mr. Chun, staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd sits in the back of the Minivan, listening to Sound of Music on his Walkman, Lulu is next to him, with her Gameboy, Zoe and Peter are half asleep. Shane climbs into the PASSENGER SEAT. Zoe realizes he's staring at her, through the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today you drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids sit bolt upright. They turn to Zoe, terrified. She gets out in shock, and gets in the driver's seat. The other Kid's seat belts CLICK loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- I can't even pass driver's Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you given a driving lesson before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N ot in a car, no... but it's a lot like a Bradley Assault Vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially when Zoe's driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids share a dubious look. Zoe backs jerkily out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is super-tense as they drive. Shane is nervous, but trying not to show it. Lulu and Todd are terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what causes most accidents? ttention span. The most important thing is that you keep an absolute focus on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe's looking RIGHT at him, not the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ROAD! Don't look at me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he Minivan brakes abruptly at a red light, just as a semi SCREAMS through the intersection. Shane is shaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Keep going. I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is surprised. Touched. She pulls out, jerkily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe pulls to the curb, almost tapping a bus's rear fender. Shane unclenches his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Next lesson, 1500 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe smiles. And the other Kids all bolt from the car, terrified. Lulu makes a big show of kissing the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha. Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: hey head into the school.   Shane spots something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER ANGLE reveals: SCOTT (Zoe's boyfriend), with a few FRIENDS, laughing, being obnoxious. Shane jumps out of the car. Before Scott knows what's happened, Shane's LIFTED him in the air by his backpack. Scott's terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know 437 ways to hurt a man without touching him. Broken promises lead to broken legs. Do we understand each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott nods, trembling. Shane lets him down and heads into school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane (Peter in lap, Tyler in snuggle) keeps an eye on the Kids at their tables. KIDS boisterously run past. Suddenly -- Claire BARKS out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHILDREN... STOP RUNNING!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids instantly freeze. Claire strides into view. She's wearing a cute dress, and a little make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long, severe stare) Now... WALK! DOUBLE TIME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastened, the kids gulp and orderly march away. Shane's eyes alight, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   I'm glad I never had you for a CO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she coyly smiles) I've noticed improvement in your troops lately, too. Noon and none of them have been called to my office. It's a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: he sits beside him, and offers him a milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy you a drink, sailor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hey eat in silence. Shane`s not so good at small talk. She's waiting for him to say... something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look nice today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This old thing? Well, you never know who you're going to run into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. He smiles back... Suddenly, there's a commotion: Murney is marching Todd towards them, dragging him by the ear. Principal Claire sighs "not again." In one move, Shane leaps over the table. Principal Claire watches him leap:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Love it when he does that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney shoves Todd forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had it. I just caught this boy dancing under the bleachers like some kind of Bavarian fruitcake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney gets up in Shane's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this freak outta my school and into treatment. Somebody needs to give this punk a talking to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm right here. Talk.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: veryone is shocked that Todd talked back. A hushed whisper goes through the cafeteria. Murney turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something to say? Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah I do. I quit, Murney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hushed "oooh" goes through the Students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winners never quit, boy. What're you so scared of, Freak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Students snicker. Todd looks, intimidated. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not scared. I... I want to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. No one's sure they heard him right. Todd pulls out a stack of SOUND OF MUSIC FLYERS and hands them out. Todd is on the poster in his Rolf costume. Principal Claire takes one: she laughs, now it all makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in Sound of Music. It opens Friday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A musical? You're blowing off wrestling for a musical? (to Shane:) This is what happens when there's no man in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a man in my house -- me. (Murney turns:) Let's get one thing clear. I'm not quitting cause I hate wresting. I'm quitting because you're a bad coach. You suck. The whole team wants to quit. I'm the only one with the guts to do it.

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: urney looks over at the Team. They look to the ground sheepishly, Todd's telling the truth. Murney looks around, humiliated, furious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- you're a tough guy now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney takes ONE STEP towards Todd -- Shane steps between them, protecting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of this, baby sitter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney glares at him -- face to face. So calm, it's scary

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you wanted to wrestle. You win. Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is watching. Murney did not expect to be called out. His voice cracks -- then he regains his calm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After school. The Gym. Your ass is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms out. There is a stunned moment -- and then a mob of Students, and a lot of CUTE GIRLS, swarm Todd, taking flyers. Shane gives Todd a proud thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A QUICK SERIES OF SHOTS: Of STUDENTS whispering to other STUDENTS, passing notes: A Kid opens a note -- it reads: "Murney's getting his ass kicked. 3:00."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bleachers are PACKED. Murney struts out onto the mat. The two fighters begin circling one another. The Wrestlers scream for Murney. Todd cheers Shane on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on, you're about to enter Murney's house of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be sure to lock up when I'm through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney roars and CHARGES Shane. Shane defensively uses Murney's momentum to flip him halfway across the mat. WHAM. Murney lands on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wrestlers mouths drop. Murney, shocked, climbs to his feet and CHARGES again, Shane side-steps, and sweeps Murney -- sending him right into the wall, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murney bounds to his feet, rushes Shane. Shane DIVES OVER Murney, grabs onto Murney's waist. Shane's momentum pulls Murney backwards -- BAM. Murney's shoulders hit the mat with Shane smiling down on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd flops to the mat, raises his hand and SLAPS it down-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane stands. Shane throws an arm around Todd, and they head out. The Wrestling Team huddles around Murney, who's quietly twitching on the ground, mumbling something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dislocated nerve, that's all. He'll be fine in (checking his watch) two months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk out. The crowd cheers. Claire, too. Shane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: smiles at her as he passes. She gives him a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Todd) Let's go, Todd. I got my troops waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane marches the Brownies through a FOREST.    He wears Peter and Tyler in front and rear Snuggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're ever lost in the woods, the first thing you have to do is find a source of drinking water! And make sure it's potable. If you're not sure, boil it for thirty minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are loving it, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to eat, right? Well let me tell you you're not gonna find Girl Scout cookies out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're Brownies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No brownies   either. A lot of roots are edible. So    is some tree bark. When I HALO'd into   Rwanda, I lived off the underground   fern stem for three weeks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane kicks over a ROCK.    Underneath are crawling BUGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insects. They look nasty but they're full of nutrients that may save your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scoops up some bugs and EATS them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's eating Roly-Polies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brownies are frozen in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full of bugs:) Wots of pwotien!

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: UPBEAT MUSIC kicks in over the following MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane leads the Brownie Troop through Combat exercises. In unison, the Girls PUNCH, KICK. PUNCH, PUNCH, KICK. Shane's got Tyler's cradle next to him, in between punches, in perfect tempo, he reaches out and rocks it. The Duck watches all this -- fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lot is empty. Shane and Zoe sit in the minivan, Shane holds a stopwatch. He signals her, she burns rubber, and races through a slalom of orange cones -- she hits EVERY ONE -- the wheel hubs are CLOGGED with cones. She skids to a stop just short of the "Severe Tire Damage" spikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane changes Tyler's diaper WITH ONE HAND. In his other hand he's reading The Brownie Handbook. It's open to a page that reads "Knot Tying."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAST is assembled on stage, where Shane has set up a scale model of the set on the floor. He illustrates the stage directions, by moving around toy army men:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- we'll put Von Trapps here, here, and... here at the top of the stairs. Now the Nazis are gonna come in, this way -- and the Von Trapp is set...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs at his own joke... The Kids don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe leaps into the minivan through the windows. Zoe peels out and weaves the cones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she only clips one, it teeters, but doesn't fall. Shane gives her a signal, she throws it in reverse and drives the course backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu, in   her BROWNIE uniform, ties a complicated knot - we WIDEN   to see she's tying Shane's hands behind his back, as   the Brownie troop watches. He counts "1,2,3... and then   begins wriggling free. They watch closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane and Zoe are huddled under the minivan's dashboard. Shane's showing her the IGNITION WIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane has the Brownies assembled. He's attached SOFA CUSHIONS to himself. The Brownies attack, mercilessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane changes Tyler's diaper RAPID-SPEED.    Hands a blur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd and "Liesl" work on the You Are Sixteen dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... your life little girl, is an empty page/that men will want to write on...

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: odd tries the spinning kick, but blows it, landing hard. Shane blows a WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just let the Nazis win tonight -- huh? Now. From the top -- think of yourself as a gazelle prancing over the plains. Graceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd tries the kick. THUD!    Shane BLOWS the whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gazelle.   Prancing. Graceful.   Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of Peter's crib, Shane performs the "Panda Dance." Singing and doing all the moves -- he's got it down, adding a James Brown flourish, now and then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that dial sleep for a while -- HEAAAY! And say good night, Peter Panda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does a spin kick. Then he tucks Peter in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to sleep) Good night, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is so touched, he almost bursts into tears. He kisses Peter on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your daddy, Peter. But sweet dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brownies sit at their cookie table beside the door. Across the lot, the Chubby Cub Scouts, at their own table, see them. The Scouts head towards the Brownies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Skeever, what's in a Girl Scout's pants when she has diarrhea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops short, the Brownies have moved into a FORMATION, ready to strike, Lulu at the front: it's (kind of) scary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away and we won't hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scouts share a look -- they LAUGH. The head Scout steps forward and grabs Lulu's cookies. In one move, she spins out of the way and pulls off his neckerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the neckerchief, but like lightning, she wraps it around his arm, tying him. She shoves a cookie in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. You're gonna have to pay for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scout struggles, the Other Scouts are scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go! Let go -- MOMMY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets him go -- in a FLIP, he lands on the ground hard. Lulu lets out another "kia!" The Girls move forward in unison, striking a cool pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane shops, wearing the double snuggle. As he's comparing prices -- he sees, on the security monitor: The Brownies attacking the Cub Scouts. He smiles, proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my troop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cub Scouts have all been tied with their own bandanas to the CART CORRAL. Shane comes out of the store, and catches Lulu, using his "catchphrase."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From now on, you do things our way -- no highway option!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scouts nod, terrified. Shane gives her a stern look, then LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane drives. The Brownies joyously CHANT a MARCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what has been said, Brownies rock! Full speed ahead! Give me guff, I'm in your face! Brownies rule the human race!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One two! Three four! One TWO THREE FOUR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane works his way down the hall, checking on the kids:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - LULU'S ROOM: LULU is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - TODD'S ROOM: The door is OPEN -- Shane peers in. Todd has a SWITCHBLADE. He is practicing with it, clicking it open, tossing it hand to hand. Off Shane's look:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West Side Story auditions in two weeks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane takes the switch blade, and performs an AMAZING trick with it, spinning Sit like a pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all in the wrist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads down to Zoe's room and peaks in -- SHE'S NOT IN BED. He rushes in -- but she's out on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe sits on the railing, she seems sad. Shane approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.    I'm not gonna jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong... Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: o. Scott's fine. I don't know what you did, but he's really straightened up. Flowers, phone calls. ...I've never been in love like this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A month...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's longer than any relationship I've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay, Shane. I'm not used to anyone giving me the benefit of the doubt. My teachers don't trust me. Mom doesn't. My dad didn't care about us, he was never here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts her, stern:) Hey. Your father cared about you very deeply. He told me you were the greatest things in his life. That what's bothering you? Cause -- we can talk about it, if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe's eye well up, then she cries. Shane holds her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss him so much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane is a little taken by surprise. Then -- he decides to answer. He takes his Sfather's MEDAL out of his pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was my dad's. He was the only family I ever had. Mom left when I was little, cause dad was always gone. Two years in... an indisclosable locale. Another six in... Another indisclosable locale. I didn't really have a home, so I went to military school -- then one day my mom got the letter. No more dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the Medal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always wanted to be just like him. I'm starting to realize, I never really knew him. I don't know if I'm like him or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's horrible, Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hardest part was living without any details...why? How? Where? I always wondered if he thought about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.   So how did you get through it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say I just shut down my emotions. I turned off all feelings and dedicated myself to becoming the perfect soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never even got to say good bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear runs down Zoe's face. She throws her arms around Shane. The phone rings. Shane answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ulie's on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red tape is cleared up, we're on the first plane in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe runs down the hall, telling the family:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy's coming home! Mommy's coming home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone wakes up, happy, sleepy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excited, the kids are all abuzz, talking excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is dark. Shane sits in a lawn chair, scoping the area with NIGHT VISION GOGGLES ON. Gary sits in the next chair. Shane sighs morosely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just another assignment. No reason for personal attachments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane takes a sip out of a juice box. He pets the Duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Gary, your wings aren't clipped. How come you don't fly away? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you've got it good.    Kids to play with. Three squares a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he Duck stares, unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All quiet on the western front. I guess I better fix that Playroom window.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: hane rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hane turns the light on. Gary follows Shane as he looks for tool. Suddenly, the Duck starts quacking... Shane turns. Gary's foot is caught in a grate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, Gary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane gets down on his hands and knees and gently pries Gary's foot from the grate. Shane is about to stand when something below catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane pulls out a pen flashlight, shines it down the grate... we see a CRANK WHEEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you suppose this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane tugs at the grate until it pops off. Shane grips the valve and tries turning it. Nothing. He tries harder, muscles rippling, and then it gives... The wheel spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he floor opens, revealing a CIRCULAR STAIRCASE, leading below the garage. Shane steps down it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a small room, and a hall leading to a STEEL DOOR. It's solid and inscrutable. No hinges or cracks. The only break in its surface is a strange, TWO-PRONGED KEYHOLE. Shane looks on stunned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane's at the Steel Door. He has high-tech tools laid out in front of him. He's been trying, unsuccessfully, to crack the lock all night. The Kids are watching his progress, Lulu hands him a tool. Shane dials a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan up from the WHITE "US GOV" license plates to Bill at the wheel. Julie sits beside him. Bill's cell phone rings, he answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir! Excellent news. I think I found GHOST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill reacts, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Do you have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's in a steel vault. I've been trying all night, can't crack it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remaining calm) Good! Good work. Okay, don't do anything further. We'll be there shortly -- don't do anything `til I get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane smiles, pleased, and hangs up. Then we slowly MOVE UP. Away from Shane... towards the neighbor's house.

dialogues.speaker: W
dialogues.text: e PUSH INTO the house. Through a window... revealing the Korean neighbors standing in the dark. Silently spying on Shane. An ominous pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GHOST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One things for sure. After we turn this in to my CO, whoever's been bothering you guys won't be bothering you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone reacts happily, relieved.   Except for -- Lulu. She looks stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Lulu? You should be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Shane -- does that mean you'll have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes silent.    Tongue-tied, he has no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys better get ready.    Your mom should be home soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's Sedan pulls up.    Julie and Bill hop out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie opens the door, comes into the dark hall. Bill is carrying her suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a fight with Zoe when I left, so they probably trashed the place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She trails off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They listen -- they hear, in the next room, Kids singing a beautiful, a capella version of The Hills are Alive (with The Sound of Music). She turns on the lights -- what she sees makes her drop her luggage, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: JULIE'S P.O.V.: The house is spotless. The rug is vacuumed. The fish tank is clear, filled with healthy TROPICAL FISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing, a capella) ... with songs they have sung, for a thousand years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumb-struck, Julie goes to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is sparkling clean, no dishes in the sink. She sees, attached to the fridge with magnets: A flyer for Sound of Music, featuring Todd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIE almost faints. Bill steadies her. She staggers to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane and the Kids are holding up a home-made sign: WELCOME HOME, MOM! Todd pushes STOP on a CD player: The Sound of Music stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is in a conservative dress, Todd a button down and khakis: barely recognizable. Lulu has bows in her hair. Peter is fresh faced, smiling, Tyler is asleep: a picture perfect family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie starts bawling. The Kids rush forward and hug her. Across the room, Shane sees Bill enter. Shane stiffens and salutes proudly.   S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he smiles wryly, then salutes back) Good job, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane leads Bill inside. Bill holds the pronged key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really proud of you, Shane. I'm giving you your choice of assignment, anywhere you want. You just name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's kind of you, Sir... pause) But I'll have to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill stops, surprised.   Shane continues, a bit reluctant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, all I've never known is the military. At nine years old my father put me in cadet school and from there I never looked back. Don't get me wrong, I wouldn't trade it for anything and I have no regrets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But being with these kids has made me feel like there's more to life than taking out your enemy. And I think I want to explore that some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, an ANGRY VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUT YOUR HANDS UP!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane and Bill spin, startled.    The CHUNS strides up, GUNS DRAWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give US THE KEY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Chun?     They checked out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H ands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compliant, Shane puts his hands behind his head. He takes a submissive position... Mrs. Chun comes closer, reaching for Bill's key... Shane shoots Bill a glance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane SPINS and grabs both guns! He WHACKS the Koreans' forearms, while SLAMMING their heads together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hane takes control! He smiles, relishing a second of glory -- when suddenly, CRACK! A third gun BUTTS him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights out. He turns, startled, and starts to fall. Disoriented, confused, he looks up as he drops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is losing consciousness. Things are spinning... woozy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arguing with Bill) You promised us GHOST months ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Chun. There were delays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane peers in confusion, then passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and the Kids are on the floor, tied up. Peter and Tyler are caged in the play pen. Peter has a JUICE BOX. The Korean Man (Mr. Chun) secures the room, closing the window shades. Bill checks the knots binding the children. They whimper, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't be baby-sitting you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He GAGS the kids.    Julie glares, livid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted you. Charles trusted you. So did the Department of Defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North Korea pays better. (to Mr. Chun) Keep an eye on them. You -- with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill GAGS Julie. The Kids are furious. Bill and Mrs. Chun exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane lies unconscious. Bill and Mrs. Chun approach the steel door. Bill inserts the two-pronged key... and it CLICKS. The door HUMS, then slides OPEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside is a dark corridor.      Bill grins.   They enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light is at the end.    They anxiously tiptoe, reaching..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE VAULT! Spare, bright and white. The floor is covered with square tiles. At the far end is a LARGE ELEVATED SAFE. Beside the safe is a red switch, with two settings: ARMED and DISARMED. It's set on ARMED. The air is filled with an ominous, low-pitched HUM, like a monstrous computer. Bill eyes the safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring your stethoscope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   But I've got some C4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She confidently strides toward the safe -- which sets off hidden flame-throwers in the walls. A jet blast of FLAME shoots out! She leaps back just in time, but the shoulder of her jacket is on fire. Bill pats out the flames with his own jacket. Chun is Bokay, just missing BOTH eyebrows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles never made things easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Chun's eyebrows are neatly, completely SINGED OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... had eyebrows... done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chun guards the kids, eyeballing them icily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu "looks" scared. But behind her back, we reveal her HANDS untying her ropes! Freed, she hits her panic button! O.S., BEEPING. Lulu grins hopefully: Shane's coming! A beat... then Mr. Chun pulls the Tracker from his pocket. He sneers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I'm stupid? Now stop bothering me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lulu frowns, then leans back against Zoe. With a rapid blur of finger-work, she unties Zoe! Then -- needing a distraction, she signals Tyler and crosses her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler GASPS, horrified -- and SCREAMS HIS LUNGS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chun spins, startled -- and Lulu quickly ROLLS across the room! She lands against Todd, quickly assuming a fake bound position, as if she hadn't moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chun whirls -- the Kids look innocent. Mr. Chun is confused for a second: "wasn't he tied to the other one?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND TODD - Lulu frantically unties Todd's ropes -- it's gonna be close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chun scowls. Skeptical, he steps closer... He leans down to look at Todd's ropes Z--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Peter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter SQUIRTS JUICE into Mr. Chun's face. The Kids use the distraction: Todd POPS to his feet, then LEAPS into his SPIN KICK: it connects with Mr. Chun's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids bounce up. They untie Julie, then scoop up Peter and Tyler. Mr. Chun growls and starts to stagger up. Lulu lands in Karate stance and calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Kids take off, Mr. Chun looks at Lulu.   Mr. Chun laughs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAM without warning, Lulu SWEEPS Mr. Chun's leg, he drops to his knees in pain, then, when he's at her level, she KICKS him right in the nuts. It HURTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chun tries to grab her by the wrist, but Lulu EVADES with her cool, snake-like move. Lulu runs, slamming the door behind her. Mr. Chun gets up and turns the doorknob, but the door won't budge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe shoves a chair between the door and the opposite wall, they're trapped inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chun punches the door, making a small hole. He reaches out to knock the chair away but he can't quite reach. He puts his face up to the hole he's made...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd's outside with a FIRE EXTINGUISHER: he blasts Mrs. Chun's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chun falls back from the door, his face COATED in white. He yells out furious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stuff doesn't hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks his face out the hole... DONNGGG -- Todd hits him square in the face with the fire extinguisher ITSELF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family comes scrambling out -- but as Julie exits, a HAND suddenly GRABS her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGGGH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SCREAMS. Bill lurches into view, clutching her! The kids are horrified. They start to run back, but she urgently gestures --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going!     RUN! Go GET HELP!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids fret, unsure, then nod and run to the side garage. Zoe and Todd load the kids into the minivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!   C'mon! Buckle up!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill pulls Julie inside. Mrs. Chun listens to Mr. Chun ON THE RADIO, speaking in Korean:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're headed for the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax -- I've got the keys, they're not going anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKS FLY as Zoe hot-wires the minivan. She floors it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: r. Chun comes racing around the house -- as SCREEEECH! The van suddenly FLOORS out, almost clipping him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARGHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chun falls, as the van PEELS backwards down the driveway, and 360's. RRRR! It shifts into drive and ROARS away. Chun hops into Bill's car and races after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod!   What are we doing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's look for a cop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sedan GUNS its engine, gaining on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oe runs a yellow. She hits the curb and goes AIRBORNE. WHOOOOOO! The kids SCREAM, as they sail through the intersection! The sedan keeps chasing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill has Julie at gunpoint, leading her to the secret door. They step past Shane's body, lying on the concrete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does what work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play dumb. It's getting old. I want to know how to get through the booby traps. What's the code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know any code -- Charles didn't tell me about the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I knew Charles had hidden it so well, I wouldn't have killed him so soon. Don't make me kill you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie GASPS, chilled. Then, a CRACKLING of static.    Mrs Chun exits the vault, holding a military RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bill, my husband has question:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a clean shot at their tires. It's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: risky, they might wreck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie goes frantic, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, don't hurt the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, everyone looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look over -- Shane is standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the code. I'll get you in... just please don't hurt anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ill eyes him. The men stare down, Bill deciding if he can trust him. Then -- he clicks "talk" on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change of plan. Bring them back unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill uncuffs Shane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicles race, Chun just inches from the kids' tail. He tries to pass them on the right. It's like a chariot race, Chun zooming by, half on the sidewalk, to cut them off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd scrambles into the back seat. He does something we can't see, as Zoe drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's taking you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wait for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sedan pulls up beside them. Zoe makes a very lewd gesture at him. It throws Mr. Chun off for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe floors it, Mr. Chun is now face to face with Todd -- who throws a dirty diaper into the his face. Mr. Chun swerves and almost wrecks. Lulu starts PELTING Mr. Chun with debris: milk cartons, crayons, orange peels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aah!     HEY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubbish clobbers him. Exasperated, Mr. Chun ROLLS UP his window, then POUNDS the gas! Faster! About to pass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe looks over. Chun is pointing a gun!             She s PULLS the emergency brake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RRRRRRRR!!    The Van SPINS into a squealing 360.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chun SCREAMS, disoriented, and loses control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
